text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hobbit Tasting. Hazy very pale yellow colour with some particles going around. Aroma is rice, some alcohol, earth, herbs and mild mushroomy and foresty notes. Flavour is tart wood, some alcohol, mild rice sweetness as well as some herbal and grassy/earthy notes. Quite burning boozy finish.

06.11.2014, 0,375l bottle (batch #9) sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Masses of sediments, looks like watery rice milk. Aroma is strange, in a good way; kind of sweet sour-ish milky, hay, nuts, brie cheese, coconut milk, grass, alcohol, butter. Taste is slightly medical dry, harsh grass, medicine, minerals, alcohol, wet hay, yeast, rice, paper. Slightly dry and mineraly watery mouthfeel, mild carbonation. Fair enough. Quite interesting though...

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a freakishly cloudy milk white body with loads of lumpy segments. Looks pretty yucky, actually. Aroma is lactic-like sour tones, walnuts, coconut milk, alcohol and hints of pepper and pears far in the back. Taste is blue cheese, coconut milk, sour lactic-like tones, hints of nuts and medicinal alcohol. Carbonated, actually with palpable chunks of sediments. Weird but somehow pleasant, interesting stuff.

375 ml bottle at home. Bottle has a three finger thick sediment layer. Some floaters in the misty bright golden body. No head. Yeasty swimming pool nose with notes of pears, apples, light malts and alcohol. Sweet and fruity with yeasty rice notes. Full bodied and alco warm. Smooth with a prickling warmth on the tongue.

Bottle at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2012. Hazy light yellow liquid with rice chunks floating in it. Aroma of rice, mushrooms, marshmallows, earth and some booze. Taste is dry and light sour with notes of mushrooms, rice and booze. Medium to full bodied. Too ricey and mushroomey for my taste.
Stockholm Beer & Whiskey 2012: Doftar spännande sött med lite belgiska toner. Vätskan är opasturiserat och aning het

Sample at SBWF 2012, Master Class with Kjetil Jikiun.

Hazy milk white with no head. Yeast and rice, also notes of alcohol. Also some weak notes of fruit. Light mouth feel.

No head. Pale milky opaque body. Milky fruity mineraly aroma. Nice, and strange. Dry-sweet alcoholic fruity milky chalky taste with alcohol notes. Thinnish body. Hot mouthfeel. Dryish fruity mineraly aftertaste with musty earthy notes. Think this might be too old. Need to try again. (0.375l bottl, wine monopoly, Vika, Oslo. Batch #009.)

Bottle shared at The Trappist.  Looks like glue, more or less, rather milky and chunky.  This is not out of the ordinary for this style though.  Nice aroma, with coconut, rice pudding, and citrus.  The flavor has a nice coconut essence with sweet rice pudding, lemon, and alcohol.  Fuller body with some chunkiness to it yet a great milky smoothness.  I liked this.
Bottle. Pours a hazy milky white color with no head. Has a fruity yeasty rice aroma.Sweetish and slightly sparkling yeasty spicy rice flavor. Has a fruity spicy yeasty finish.

Bottle 375ml @ Beer2000
[Courtesy of Beer2000] Pours cloudy skimmed milky white with no head. Aroma has notes of rice and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet with an alcohol finish. Texture is oily.
Bottle.Pours cloudy white  with no head.Aroma of rice , alcohol, glue and caramel.Flavor is sweet , salty and  alcohol with some rice and caramel.Medium body, no head.

Bottle 350ml. [ As Yamahai Nigori Nama Junmai-Shu ].Hazy milk white color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, yeasty, floral, citrus notes, moderate alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light citrus acidic with a average to long duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. [20100920]
Bottled @ tasting cgarvieuk. Cloudy off-white coloured. Aroma is rice, bit of cococonut. Flavour is rice, pineapple, slightly sour, hint of proteins?

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2011 bottle at bens ... yeast 701 .... batch 001 .... bottled 29.04.10... very clowdy .... loads of bits ... soft creamy coconut nose ... fizzy ... sharp tart rice .... soft rice ... not working as well as last one... big alcohol ... little pineapple ... 2.8 same bottle at home ...very hazy white ...  big pineapple nose ... little tartness ... ligth sharp but not as much as first time ... lots of alcohol. 2.9
same bottle 8-02-11 ... hazy white ... sofe pine apple nose ... light tartness ... tart sourness... little coconut husk .... 2.8

Bottled. A milky white sake with some chunks floating around. The aroma has notes of yeast, rice, and alcohol. The flavor has notes of alcohol, rice, and lemon, leading to a dry finish where the rice and alcohol notes lingers and a note of cedarwood appears.
Bottle. Unclear white with no head. The aroma is light acid, sweet rice and pale fruit. The flavour is riace, sweetness and light bread like.

Bottle 35 cl. Pours a cloudy pale almost milky white with loads of floaties and some lumpy yeast floating on top. Very boozy aroma and a touch of rice. Medium body, quite carbonated, has some dry white wine characteristics. Somewhat flat and tired mouthfeel. 171110

Bottle. It doesnt look very nice, with its yellowish milky body with lots of chunks. Fortunately the aroma and flavor are much better. Theres a hint of cellar in the aroma, as well as fruit-schnaps and some rice. Not much rice aroma or flavor, both are more on the fruity side and with the alcohol sure playing a significant role. Its full-bodied, warming, chunky and quite dry on the palate, some co2 too. Dry finish. A quite nice and tasteful one, but it looks bad. 100611
Bottle. Milky white colour with no head. Aroma is sweet, alcohol, rice. Flavour is sweet, alcohol, rice floral, yeast, fruit. OK sake.

A watery white colour with white sediments
Aroma; High alcohol notes and some lemon youghurt
Flavours; A good sweetnes and acid balance. A clear riceflavour.
Summary; This sits for minuttes, a good sake!

350 ml bottle. Milky white body with rice floaters. Mild aroma of rice, flowers and a hint of marzipan and herbs. Flavor is smooth rice, yeast fruitiness and a very nice kind of fruity acidity. Tastes smoother than it looks. Both smooth and a bit raw at the same time. I especially appreciated the acidity in the aftertaste.

4cl sample. hazy light colour. Aroma is dry and bitter. Yeasty and a bit dusty. Reminiscent of a dry white wine. Flavour is dry and bitter, Thin and watery. Acidious. Yeasty and fruity. Long aftertaste.
milky white no head. Aroma is rice, a bit boozy, milky, faint  flowery. Flavor is candy, flowers, rice, sort of dry flowery taste.
35 cL bottle. Pours hazy white no head. Acidic and milky aroma. Smooth fruity and lacto flavoured. Sweet milky rice flavour. Smooth fruity and lingering finish.

White milky pour. Rice flavours. Slightly boozy. Plain.

(This is not a rating as much as it is my fragmental memory notes)
UPDATED: NOV 17, 2010 Bottle at MikkellerBAR. Light milkey white - no head. Rice. Sharpness. Acid. Alcoholic. Light flowery. Citric. Ok.

Bottle at Haandverkerstuene, Oslo.  Nihonshudo: -3, Seimaibuai 70%.
Almost explosive, extremely fizzy. Pours vailla-coloured with white lumps. Not the most delicate nigori sake I have seen. That said, the aroma has some nice herbal character, though also quite yeasty and extremely alcoholic. Some refreshing acidity, hints of herbs, undermined by overwhelming alcohol. Ends quite dry. The big lumps are not particularly pleasant in the mouth either, in my opinion, a far cry from a milky, smooth nigori. Maybe I had a bad bottle; it seemed well into the next stage of fermentation. What a waste of 25 euro...

Bottles with sediment, courtesy of the brewery. ABV was 17%. Unfiltered and unpasteurised. Cloudy very pale milk coloured sake, with white rice floaties in the glass. The bottles were difficult to open due to carbonation / gushing. Yeasty, fruity and alcoholic aroma, also notes of marzipan. The flavour is fresh, fruity and quite nice. Warming mouthfeel.
